result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th). The defendant was found guilty of both charges. Because Wisconsin law provides for only one penalty even if there is a conviction on both, no additional penalty has been imposed as a result of the second charge.

  • Steven D. Stone was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Steven D. Stone was found guilty of Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).
  • Steven D. Stone was found guilty of Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

On record at 8:46am.  Court calls case and appearances. Court speaks to the State. Court speaks to Atty Schlough.  Court speaks to all parties.  Atty Schlough speaks to the court.  Court is to make the finding of number of offenses.  Court finds the def. freely and knowingly waives his right to have the jury decide the number off offenses.  Court speaks to the parties.  Off record 9:01am 
Back on record at 9:09am Court calls case and appearance. Clerk swears in all jurors. Court begins questioning.  Juror 742 makes statement. Juror 1070 makes statement.  Jurors 585,689,256,742 make statements.  Juror 742 is excused.  Clerk seats juror 1112. Juror 921 makes statement.  Jurors 53 & 921 makes statement.  Juror 921, 678 & 53 makes statement.  Jurors 394,678,11,12,17,204 make statements re: prior jury service. Jurors 1070,204,1063,175,53,1112 makes statement. Jurors 175,394,256 makes statement.  Juror 175 excused.  Clerk seats juror 381. Juror makes statement.  Court excuses juror 381. Clerk seats juror 726. Court excuses juror 256. Clerk seats juror 1197.  Juror 610 speaks to the court.  Multiple jurors raise hands re: OWI questions. Court speaks to juror in jury room.  Court continues questioning all jurors.  Juror 610 makes statement, juror is excused.  Clerk seats juror 1271. Court questions all jurors re: sleep.  No questions from the state.  Atty Schlough questions the panel.  Attorneys strike jurors.  Court calls 12 jurors. Clerk swears in selected jurors.  Off record at 10:30.
Back on record at 10:40.  Attorneys speak to the court.  Court begins with jury instructions. State gives opening statement.  Atty Schlough gives opening statement.  State calls Ms. Krystal Kennedy to the stand. Clerk swears in witness.  State begins questioning.  Nothing further from the state. Cross from Atty Schlough.  Nothing further. Redirect from the state.  Nothing further. Witness is excused.  State calls Jeremy Kennedy to the stand. Clerk swears in Mr. Kennedy. State begins questioning.  Nothing further from the state. Cross from Atty Schlough.  Nothing further. Redirect from the State. Nothing further. Witness is excused.  State calls Deputy Nick Helstern to the stand.  Clerk swears in Deputy Helstern.  State begins questioning.  Nothing further from the state.  Cross from Atty Schlough.  Nothing further. Redirect from the state. Nothing further. Witness is excused.  Break for lunch at 11:56am.  
Back on record at 12:58am.  State calls Deputy Joshua Christman to the stand. Clerk swears the Deputy Christman.  State begins questioning.  Atty Schlough makes objection, requesting jury be excused.  Atty Schlough speaks to the court.  State speaks to the court.  Court speaks to the parties re: testimony. Court grants motion and testimony is stricken what was found in the vehicle.  Jury returns. State continues questioning.  Court has jury leave the room. Court speaks to the witness.  Jury returns.  State continues questioning.  State offers exhibit 1- 1 is received.   State continues questioning.  Nothing further from the state. Cross from Atty Schlough.  Nothing further. Redirect from the state.  Nothing further.  Recross from Atty Schlough. Nothing further. Witness is excused.  State calls Patty Peterson to the stand. Clerk swears in Ms. Peterson. State begins questioning. Nothing further. Cross from Atty Schlough.  Nothing further. Witness excused.  State calls Catherine Smith to the stand.  Court speaks to the attorneys. Off record at 2:03pm. Back on record at 2:11pm.   State calls Catherine Smith to the stand. Clerk swears in Ms. Smith. State begins questioning. State offers exhibit 2-2 received.  State continues questioning.  Nothing further from the state. State offers exhibit 4- 4 is received.  Cross from Atty Schlough.  Nothing further from Atty Schlough.  Witness is excused.  No further witnesses. State rests.  Jury stands down. Defense moves for dismissal. State speaks to the court.  Motion is denied.  State offers exhibit 5-5 received.  Court speaks to the defendant.  Off record at 2:39pm Back on record at 2:45pm.  Court speaks to the defendant. Defendant wishes to remain silent.  Court finds the def. freely and knowingly waives his right to testify.  Off record at 2:47pm.  Back on record at 2:51. Court reviews jury instructions w/ attorneys.  Atty Schlough objects on jury instructions. Request is denied.  Jury returns. Defense rests.  Evidence is closed.  Court gives jury instructions.  Closing arguments.   Rebuttal from the state.   Court finishes jury instructions.  Atty Schlough speaks re: exhibits.  Off record at 3:38pm
Back on record at 4:00pm in small court room.  Atty Schlough speaks to the court.  Clerk swears in Ms. Jessica L. Powers.  Clerk swears in Ms. Powers.  Court begins questioning.  Witness is excused.  Atty Schlough calls Deputy Christman. Atty Schlough questions Deputy Christman. Witness excused.  Record is complete.  Off record at 4:08pm
Back on record at 4:49pm
Verdict-
Count 1- The jury finds the def. guilty. Court receives verdict.
Count 2-The jury finds the def. guilty. Court receives verdict.
Count 3-The jury finds the def. guilty. Court receives verdict.
Court speaks to the jurors.  Court speaks to the attorneys.  Court receives exhibit 5.  
Court finds that the def. has prior OWI convictions.  Court finds this is 6th convictions for OWI.
